TopicTitle: Why are rants and complaints ignored...

Articles.Content: By the people who sell this game? I just bought a nice joystick and throttle (X-55 Rhino) which I thought would increase the immersion of this fabulous game a bit... WRONG... it has turned into a ridiculous, convoluted mess. I haven't seen any response by a dev on any point... The forum watchdogs will quickly smother any complaints to the "proper" forum and that's it... That is all that gets resolved by the people who rake in the dough. My devices seem to work for almost every other game out there, and the modding community picks up the slack for every other issue. I've seen a dozen threads about the same problems over and over, and nothing gets done... the next release "should" fix that. Good luck with that... I'm looking at some beautiful high end PAPERWEIGHTS on my desk as I type this... So, the pedants take over from here. Post yer logs and a bunch of other crap that take ninja skills to even understand. Wow...really? This game is 50% flight sim, yet wont support a effin joystick and throttle?

Oh boy. Here we go.

18 minutes ago, vixr said:

[Why are rants and complaints ignored] by the people who sell this game?

Rants are ignored because of just that. They're rants. According to Google, rant means "speak or shout at length in a wild, impassioned way." The words "wild" and "impassioned" do not evoke calm, adult feedback. Complaints are not ignored. Example: The entire bloody support forum. Post a specific description of the problem, along with your log files if relevant, within a day people will help you.

They moderate the discussion, and keep it civil. Cough cough.)

Rants are ignored, as others have pointed out, because there is nothing in them which can be acted upon. Bug reports are addressed as staff time allows, in the order that matters can be profitably addressed, and roughly in proportion to their severity and the number of players they affect. No one can guarantee that the particular problems you encounter will be Squad's priority. We post proper bug reports and then we wait our turn. And this is really all that can be said on the matter, so this thread will be closed now before it turns nasty.
